Contents:
They've captured me. Myne plot to steal from their horde, to get but scratch ov their power, hath failed. All ey wanted was knowledge, ant now I am but prisoner to True Drakyn and their bairns. Ey am at their mercy...ant most likely, will not survif sunrise. But I may haf, in wae, succeeded. Ey think ey begin to see how they lif.

Tis not obvious, tu us; lack ov understanding of the world as it is from their perspective (ey can scarcely even imagine what it must look lyk from thiyr perch of tyme and hiyght), but tis folluws the same princyples.

When ey arrived her, I saw twere no farmt, n nu hunting. Gilded cage ant silver wicker-trash. I did not understand; but as ey observed, I learnt more. Tha lesser Drakkyn breathe whyt flesh ant blood. But True Drakkyn. True Drakkyn...

Wealth ant power; these things art connectid, yae? But tis run deeper. We all, in fact, hath presumed too narrow a definition of 'wealth'. Tis naut psila 'lone. Unter normal-rul 'pon Psydonia, all-lyfe gets more enynrgie (anima! water n fud or other) to sustain itself. Whaot of the excess, then??? Tas becom Wealth. The harvest used for paying levy, r the extra wood to construct chapel ant cart. Thes becomet wealt, and then society, and then frum thar all-things.

True Drakkyn du not neet water or food or other, lyke us mortals. They are -other. They skip need of anima an food an water, ant pulse-blood of wealth ant power (one thing disguised as two). Is this wher Matthios found hys fire?? Is tha idea nof True Drakyn??? To take his sword, ant cut a hole in the firmament tu floodyth reality wit Wealth? Thene nath he been inspired by them? Then theyr naut mortal, surely? They must be, in their own right, [ The book abruptly ends. ]
